title: New Zealand Bankruptcy Adjudications
description: Bankruptcies in New Zealand decreased to 36 Individuals in October from 54 Individuals in September of 2022. Bankruptcies in New Zealand averaged 177.25 Individuals from 2003 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 341 Individuals in November of 2006 and a record low of 24 Individuals in January of 2022. In New Zealand, bankruptcy refers to a legal process where the assets of an insolvent person are administered and distributed by the Official Assignee for the benefit of all of their creditors. This page provides - New Zealand Bankruptcy Adjudications- actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: New Zealand Insolvency and Trustee Service
